required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Head Positions and Type of Blades for Endotracheal Intubation Using a Videolaryngoscope
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Head Positions and Type of Blades on Endotracheal Intubation Using a Videolaryngoscope

brief_summary.textblock: In this study, we evaluate the effect of head positions (simple extension vs. sniffing position) and type of blades (blades for normal and difficult airways) on endotracheal intubation using a videolaryngoscope.

primary_outcome.description: The time taken for endotracheal intubation is recorded.

secondary_outcome.description: POGO score is recorded during endotracheal intubation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Procedure (At the end of endotracheal intubation)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of attempts for endotracheal intubation is recorded.
Ease of endotracheal intubation is assessed.
Presence of pharyngeal wall injury is observed.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Simple extension and blade for normal airways
arm_group.description: After induction of anesthesia, endotracheal intubation was performed in simple extension using a McGrath MAC videolaryngoscope with a blade for normal airways.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Simple extension and blade for difficult airways
arm_group.description: After induction of anesthesia, endotracheal intubation was performed in simple extension using a McGrath MAC videolaryngoscope with a blade for difficult airways.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Sniffing position and blade for normal airways
arm_group.description: After induction of anesthesia, endotracheal intubation was performed in a sniffing position using a McGrath MAC videolaryngoscope with a blade for normal airways.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Sniffing position and blade for difficult airways
arm_group.description: After induction of anesthesia, endotracheal intubation was performed in a sniffing position using a McGrath MAC videolaryngoscope with a blade for difficult airways.

intervention.description: Endotracheal intubation is performed in simple head extension or sniffing position using a McGrath MAC videolaryngoscope with a blade for normal or difficult airways
intervention.arm_group_label: Simple extension and blade for difficult airways
Simple extension and blade for normal airways
Sniffing position and blade for difficult airways
Sniffing position and blade for normal airways

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients scheduled for general aensthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- Limited neck extension
- Anatomical anormalies or history of surgery in the upper airway
- Weak teeth
- Risk of pulmonary aspiration
